comment: Dudes a good teacher and funny but he can communicate a bit better towards what he wants. Thankful he allowed notes for last test. Practical was stupid hard, no one got it right because he didn't tell us what to do or expect. My last class to graduate, and was challenging!

Professor Austin is an excellent teacher. I hope to have him for future classes. He actually teaches and knows what he is saying unlike some other ISA/IS professors at KSU (A la Green). It is true that some of his sample code has typos but they are usually pretty easy to spot.

Richard Austin should not be associated with the sea of tech hacks that make up the faculty of the KSU CS/IS/ISA departments. He's actually got  experience! He's not a recent grad trying to pass off fake experience either. He is helpful to both geeks and business oriented students. Take a class with him just to realize what a hack isn't.

Great professor. One of the best at KSU in the CS/IS/ISA department. He's got real world experience, a pleasant attitude, and does a great job at delivering the material. I'd definitely take him again.

Austin is good, but his code is littered with typos. If he actually compiled the examples he wouldn't have syntax from 3 different languages mixed together. Seems to know a little about security, but I don't think he's got much real world experience. Id say his more of an IT guy, and they are a dime a dozen. He's still better than 90% of the rest.

This guy is a great professor.  If you ask him he will offer you all the help that he can.  The subject isn't the easiest in my opinion but he makes it a lot easier than it has to be.  Doing the homework is a must, but it was nothing overwhelming.

Richard Ausitn is an excellent old style professor who wants you to learn and succeed. Uses 19 Deadly sins. Pearl Great, Powershell book so-so.  Do his homework and use bounded notebook for notes and you can uses it on the exams and pass with an A.  He is worth the class! R. Burns Class of 2008
Great Instructor! Great wealth of knowledge and experience. Uses 19 Deadly Sins which is excellent. Allows bound handwritten notes on exams.  Powershell book was so-so.

Very laid back, great sense of humor, makes learning fun. DO THE HOMEWORK and you've got a strong chance at a good grade. He knows programming isn't for everyone, and is willing to cut you a break if you show some honest effort. I wish he could teach all my classes.
